description: From Arabic دَاو‎ (dāw), from Persian دو‎ (“run”), from Proto-Indo-European *dʰew- (“to run”).

entries.meaning: (nautical) A traditional sailing vessel used along the coasts of Arabia, East Africa, and the Indian Ocean, generally having a single mast and a lateen sail.
examples: Joshua continued preparing breakfast, Bijan returned to piloting the dhow offshore and Pourghasem returned to his watch. […] Several dhows were on the water and some fishermen were already at work.
